message: Happy New Year! Wishing you a happy and healthy 2017. I’m looking forward to continuing to serve the people of Louisville.
Just sworn in for the 115th Congress. I’m looking forward to serving as the top Democrat on the House Budget Committee this Congress, and continuing to represent the proud people of Louisville.
The VICE News team came to Louisville to take a look at what will happen in the ongoing fight to combat opioid abuse if Congressional Republicans are successful in repealing the Affordable Care Act.
Be safe in this winter weather, Louisville! Keep up with the Louisville Metro Public Works weather response map here: apps.lojic.org/metrosnowroutes

It was great to sit down with 89.3 WFPL News Louisville for the latest episode of their incredibly interesting Five Things podcast. You can listen to my appearance below or find it wherever you get your podcasts.

A new study conducted by The Commonwealth Fund shows that Republican efforts to repeal Obamacare and end the Medicaid expansion could cost Kentucky 45,000 public and private sector jobs in 2019 alone. Read more here: http://www.commonwealthfund.org/Publications/Issue-Briefs/2017/Jan/Repealing-Federal-Health-Reform

Are you concerned about what repeal of the Affordable Care Act and Kentucky’s Medicaid expansion could mean for you and your family? Join me this Sunday afternoon for a public forum with elected officials, health advocates, and Kentuckians who face losing their health care coverage if this important law is repealed.

Feel free to share the Facebook event below to help get the word out for the public forum I’m hosting this Sunday to discuss what repeal of the Affordable Care Act and Kentucky’s Medicaid expansion will mean for families here in Louisville.
I'll be testifying before the Rules Committee AGAINST the Republican efforts to repeal the Affordable Care Act. Watch here:
I’m headed down to the House floor to lead Democratic efforts to protect the Affordable Care Act and stand against Republican attempts to repeal this vital law. Watch here:

TOMORROW: Join me for a public forum with elected officials, health advocates, and Kentuckiana who face losing their health care coverage if the Affordable Care Act and Kentucky's Medicaid expansion are repealed.

REMINDER: Join me today at 2:00pm for my public forum on the impact of repeal of the Affordable Care Act and Kentucky's Medicaid expansion, or tune in here on my Facebook page for a Facebook Live stream of the event.

Today, we honor the legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. and are called to protect his dream of a truly equal and just America. #MLKDay

As the transition of power is a hallmark that must be honored, this is not a decision I make lightly. It’s not my intent to protest the election results or to make a statement about policy. I will not be attending the inauguration because I believe the office of the President deserves our respect, and that respect must begin with the President-elect himself.   For the last ten weeks, President-elect Trump has continually denigrated the office of the President by using his bully pulpit for insult and ridicule. Since he made his ignorant comments about Congressman John Lewis this weekend, I have heard dismay from hundreds of constituents. Thousands more have contacted me over the past months regarding his shameful remarks about women, the disabled, immigrants, and countless others — as well as his continued praise of a hostile foreign leader.   This is not normal. It is an embarrassment to our country and to the office of the presidency, and we must send the message that this behavior is not acceptable from the leader of our nation. Not attending the Inauguration is one way for me to do that.
I enjoyed speaking with MSNBC's Kate Snow about the Affordable Care Act and Friday's Inauguration this afternoon.
Proud to introduce the Muhammad Ali Commemorative Coin Act today with my colleague Rep. David Schweikert.

Proud to be one of the thousands of Kentuckians speaking out against President Trump's unlawful and unconstitutional Executive Order. Call your elected officials and ask them to stand up for the principles on which our nation was founded.

No matter who President Trump picks in tonight's reality show ceremony, Senate Democrats owe him nothing more than the consideration Merrick Garland got.

Today, House Republicans brought legislation to the floor that would gut clean water protections for mining communities. I responded with a challenge: drink tainted water from the well of the Urias family's home in Pike County, Kentucky, and I'd support their reckless bill. None of my Republican colleagues took me up on the offer.

Tonight, we needed to see that this President wants the trust of the American people and that he has found the desire and the discipline to govern. Instead we got a showman who insulted their intelligence, manipulated facts, and distorted reality in the United States Capitol. As a country we went into this speech needing confidence from our President, our Commander in Chief, but we’ve only been given more reason for concern.
Tonight, as he has for years, Governor Steven L. Beshear showed strong leadership in his work to improve the lives of working people everywhere. The contrast was not subtle.
Looking forward to joining Cheddar LIVE at 10am ET this morning to discuss President Donald J. Trump's address to Congress last night. Watch here:

Attorney General Jeff Sessions lied under oath and has to go. It shouldn’t even be his decision to resign—President Trump must fire him immediately. Nearly every single day, new information emerges that further proves the need for an independent investigation into President Trump’s personal, political, and financial ties to the Russians. The American people deserve answers.
President Donald J. Trump's new Muslim ban is similar to the last one: it makes us less safe, discriminates, and continues to embarrass us around the world.
When Kentucky Humanities Council, Inc. said they were bringing a Kentucky icon to Washington, I just assumed they meant Bill Goodman. Great #HumHill17 meeting today.

My heart goes out to those who were made to fear for their lives or the lives of their children because of today's bomb threat at the Louisville JCC. I commend JCC leadership and first responders for the way they handled the matter and am relieved no one was hurt. It's a truly sad reality that this latest anti-Semitic threat comes as a surprise to no one. There have been more than 100 threats to Jewish Community Centers, schools, and organizations in the last two months, as well as vandalism at several Jewish cemeteries across the country. I called on the U.S. Department of Justice and Homeland Security to aggressively investigate those incidents and will continue to do so. All Americans deserve the peace of mind of knowing that their leaders will stand with them regardless of their faith, skin color, or ethnicity. This fear and hate cannot become the new norm.
Wearing National Kidney Foundation's #MyKidneysMyLife sticker today in honor of World Kidney Day. I’m proud to support efforts to raise awareness of kidney disease in Congress.
The White House can send whoever they want to Kentucky. It won't change the fact that GOP repeal of the Affordable Care Act covers less, costs more, and gives a huge tax cut to millionaires.

I hope that Speaker Ryan and Majority Leader McConnell will move quickly to seek congressional approval of yesterday’s action, so that the constitutional prerogatives of Congress’s war-making authority are asserted. No escalation of military activity in Syria or the region can proceed without explicit congressional approval.

President Trump’s decision to withdraw from the Paris Accord makes clear that the United States is not only abdicating its role as a world leader but is staking a claim as one of the great threats to global progress. Last year, the world’s nations came together out of urgent necessity and agreed with near unanimity to work together in combating the most pressing crisis of our time. The President’s decision to now reverse course betrays our allies, undermines our credibility, and exacerbates a global catastrophe.  There are no winners in this decision. America’s influence will now dwindle, the climate will continue to wreak havoc, and — despite the myths perpetuated by the President and his anti-science allies — our economy will suffer tremendously. Doubling down on denial will not bring back coal jobs, and the bliss of this ignorant misstep will be short-lived once the dire consequences begin to take their toll.
Today, on National Gun Violence Awareness Day, I join citizens throughout Louisville and across our country in demanding ACTION to address our nation's gun violence epidemic.
‪Remembering The Greatest one year after he passed. A champion for peace, justice, and equality. Hell of a boxer, too. #RememberAli‬
Today, we remember the brave souls who stormed the beaches of Normandy 73 years ago in defense of our freedom, and thank all who serve for their sacrifices.

It’s for the lawyers to say what constitutes obstruction of justice, but today’s hearing confirms some of our worst fears: that this is a president with no regard for our institutions and national safeguards, who cannot be trusted to tell the truth, and who would not hesitate to manipulate or malign public servants for personal gain. Republicans throwing around the word "vindication" are doing nothing more than proving the tragically low standard to which they are holding this president.
Joined Thomas Roberts on MSNBC this morning to discuss President Trump's inability to tell the truth.
Congratulations to University of Louisville Baseball! Omaha bound! #CWS2017
‪One year since the Pulse nightclub shooting, let us remember that hate will never have a place here. Love always endures. #WeAreOrlando‬
Saddened to hear of the passing of Dave Armstrong, who provided great leadership for our community and our state. His family is in my thoughts.

Today, I wrote to Department of Health & Human Services (HHS) Secretary Tom Price seeking an update on Governor Matt Bevin's dangerous Medicaid waiver request. HHS’s decision on the Governor’s waiver request could mean life or death for tens of thousands of Kentuckians. Our Governor has put Kentucky in a dangerous no-win situation. 85,000 Kentuckians will lose coverage if his waiver is approved, far more if it is denied. Unless the Governor reverses course, Kentucky families covered by Medicaid expansion must prepare for their health coverage to be taken away. This isn't rhetoric, it's a serious warning for those covered by our Medicaid expansion, particularly for Kentuckians with serious or life-threatening medical conditions. I’ve called on Governor Bevin to withdraw his request. He hasn't. So families must be prepared. I'll share HHS’s response once received. LINK: https://yarmuth.house.gov/press/yarmuth-seeks-update-on-governor-bevins-medicaid-waiver/
This Juneteenth, we should work to better understand the experiences that shaped our nation & strive to achieve equality for all.
NA

From health care repeal, to the budget, to protecting the American Dream--President Trump continues to break the promises he made to the American people.  As your representative in Congress, I promise you I will not be silent.

For the fourth time, the Congressional Budget Office has issued a stark warning: Trumpcare will leave millions without insurance, drive up out-of-pocket costs, and gut critical protections for Americans with pre-existing conditions.  The consequences  are clear and devastating. For the sake of the millions of people whose health is on the line, I implore my Senate colleagues to defeat this inhumane legislation.

George Burney was a force in Louisville and beyond, fighting for equality and a better life for all. Every Christmas season he brought joy and gifts to west Louisville children, and I know his many neighbors will always remember his generous spirit. I am proud to have known him for years and called him a friend.

Under the Senate health care repeal bill, 541,000 Kentuckians would lose coverage. Our uninsured rate would jump 231%. Read more here: http://www.urban.org/sites/default/files/publication/91501/2001383-qs_state_by_state_coverage_senate_final_6.27_7.pdf
A must-read for anyone interested in the health care debate.

These emails are clear and compelling evidence that Donald Trump Jr. conspired with a hostile foreign government in an attempt to influence our American election. There must be consequences.

Julius Friedman, as much as anyone else, represents the creative spirit and genius of Louisville. His posters are iconic, but his love for our community, and his passion for telling Louisville's story in his art, will inspire us for generations to come. His contributions to the art world and his love of the creative enterprise will be impossible to replace. As a longtime friend, I will miss his humor, his insights, and his unique perspective on humanity.

A stunning admission from HHS Secretary Tom Price yesterday:  The GOP repeal plan would take us back to the days before Affordable Care Act, when:  • Insurance companies decided who lived and who died. • There were annual and lifetime limits on care. • Being a woman was a pre-existing condition. • Americans with pre-existing conditions and disabilities were charged more or denied coverage. • Families were forced to pay staggering out-of-pocket costs for fewer protections.

Republican Senators just proved that they care more about political victories than the health of American families. They have voted to put at risk the health coverage of more than 20 million Americans, protections for pre-existing conditions, and access to affordable, quality coverage for all. Republican Senators still have a chance to put their constituents first by voting against final passage of Trumpcare, and for the sake of millions I hope they do.

Today, the President of the United States marked the anniversary of the integration of the U.S. Armed Forces by reintroducing division and discrimination into our military policy and forcing out thousands of Americans who volunteered to protect our country. With his transgender military ban, President Trump is exploiting both the LGBT community and many of our military heroes in an obvious attempt to distract from his flailing, scandal plagued White House. His assertion that the ban will improve military decisiveness is absurd and a weak attempt at justifying discrimination. It has no place in our military or a 21st Century America.
‪I'll be joining House Democratic Leader Nancy Pelosi and my fellow House Democrats for a press conference shortly. Watch LIVE here:

Early this morning, the Senate rejected a plan that would have taken health care away from millions while not improving coverage for a single American.  Thanks to everyone who put pressure on their elected officials to stop this monstrous legislation. Your calls, emails, and protests worked.   Every American deserves access to the health care they need.  As we move forward, it's time for Congressional Republicans to listen to the American people and work with Democrats to improve and strengthen the Affordable Care Act.  This doesn’t stop in Washington. Some states have successfully implemented the law, others have not. They all must play a role in replicating the parts of the ACA that are working well, while fixing the areas that aren’t. This issue is too important to let politics stand in the way.
Another wonderful reminder of why I'm so proud to represent Louisville in Congress.
‪It wouldn't be summer without Mr. Hauck's Annual Dainty Contest in Schnitzelburg. In great company with Mayor Greg Fischer and Ron Mazzoli.‬

Are you a high school or college student interested in learning more about the Financial Aid process and how to make the most out of your education?  Join me for my College Prep and Financial Aid Workshop on Tuesday, August 29 at 6:30pm. RSVP today at Yarmuth.house.gov/rsvp.

I join Americans across the country in mourning today’s tragic loss of life in Charlottesville, Virginia in the violent aftermath of a white supremacist rally. I reject the disgusting and un-American display that fueled it. This is the predictable consequence of the increasing political provocations that have fanned the flames of racist hate. Failing to acknowledge that obvious fact, or pretending that everyone shares responsibility for this tragedy, is sheer deception. It is past time for our national leaders — starting with our President — to take a strong stand against bigotry and condemn hate speech before it turns violent. Anything less is a cowardly abdication of our solemn obligation to the people who elected us.

Are you a high school or college student interested in learning more about the Financial Aid process and how to make the most out of your education? Join me for my College Prep and Financial Aid Workshop on Tuesday, August 29 at 6:30pm. RSVP today at yarmuth.house.gov/rsvp.

Justice is blind. Presidents can't be. There was only one evil side in Charlottesville. Read my letter to President Donald J. Trump: https://yarmuth.house.gov/press/yarmuth-sends-letter-to-trump-in-response-to-his-latest-charlottesville-remarks/

The Department of Interior’s decision to halt this important study is yet another example of this administration’s irresponsible budget priorities that are damaging scientific research and jeopardizing the health and safety of American families. We have a public health crisis in Appalachia that is the direct result of mountaintop removal mining. The fact that mountaintop removal permits have been approved when there has never been a federal study on the health effects of mountaintop removal mining is shameful enough. To now prevent this study from being completed would be reprehensible.

President Trump simply can't stand the quiet.
Arpaio pardon an outrageous assault on our concept of justice. President Trump again shows he has no moral compass. Sad and tragic.

REMINDER: Join me tomorrow, August 29th, from 6:30pm-8:30pm in Louisville Male Traditional High School's Gheens Auditorium for my College Prep & Financial Aid Workshop. Whether you're a student yourself or the parent of a student, come learn more about the financial aid process, what Federal and State opportunities may be available, and how and when to apply. Share this event or tag any students you know in the comments below to make sure they're aware of this opportunity!

Do you know a Louisville-area high school or college student interested in learning how to best navigate the financial aid process? Share this post or tag them in the comments below.  Tonight, I’ll be hosting a College Prep & Financial Aid Workshop with representatives from Kentucky Higher Education Assistance Authority (KHEAA) from 6:30-8:30pm in Louisville Male Traditional High School’s Gheens Auditorium. Representatives from 55,000 Degrees, UPSjobs's Earn & Learn Program, the Community Foundation of Louisville, and JFCS Louisville will also be on hand to provide students with information on opportunities available to help pay for college.

This Labor Day, we recognize the dedication and service of the men and women who empower our economy, drive innovation, and make this nation the greatest in the world. I'll continue to fight for a living wage, safer working conditions, and health care and retirement benefits that provide a level of certainty in these increasingly uncertain times. Our workers deserve nothing less.

President Trump’s decision to terminate the DACA program and upend the lives of more than 800,000 innocent young people—nearly all of whom have never called any country home but the United States of America—is cruel, inhumane, and harmful to us all. These are people who were brought here as children, played by the rules, and earned diplomas. They contribute to their communities and participate in a workforce that wants and needs them. Denying them the opportunity to continue to live the only lives they know and to tear them away from their families simply to placate the savage demands of political extremists is morally bankrupt. These young people did everything asked of them. If we want to be a country that lives by our ideals, that rewards merit and hard work, it is our obligation to reject the president's heartless decision.
Proud to join my fellow Democrats in the House and Senate today as we stand up for America's DREAMers in the wake of President Trump's cruel decision to end DACA.
NA

With the stroke of a pen, President Donald J. Trump just jeopardized the health and wellness of 62.4 million American women. Birth control IS health care.

At the heart of today’s Clean Power Plan decision is one of the cruelest deceptions perpetrated in politics today: telling the American people that clean air protections are responsible for reduced demand for coal and that getting rid of these protections will create tens of thousands of coal jobs. Both are false. In fact, even President Trump’s own Energy Department just issued a comprehensive report which clearly states that the biggest contributor to coal plant retirements has been cheap, abundant natural gas, not environmental regulations or renewable energy. The facts are clear and by willfully ignoring them, the Trump Administration is jeopardizing our environment, our economy, and—ultimately—our existence. For the sake of future generations, I hope we will be able to fix the damage.
Bearcats were running loose in the Capitol today. Great to welcome Kentucky Country Day School students to Washington!

With one signature, President Trump is now jeopardizing the health security of millions of Americans. The President’s executive order calls for allowing insurance companies to build a huge market of junk plans, which will return us to the days where American families are one major illness or accident away from bankruptcy. Under these plans, insurers can deny coverage to people with pre-existing conditions, meaning only people who are currently healthy will buy them. The end result will be that costs for everyone else will soar, and ultimately, insurance markets that provide real coverage with real protections will collapse. Welcome to Trumpcare.

President Trump’s decision to decertify Iran’s compliance with the nuclear agreement jeopardizes international security and weakens America’s position as a global leader. Rather than trust and listen to the conclusions of our U.S. military leadership, the State Department, our intelligence community, and the United Nations’ own nuclear inspectors—who have all confirmed that Iran is complying with the agreement—the President is disregarding the facts and ignoring reality. President Trump is daring Iran to pursue a path toward a nuclear weapon and damaging America's credibility in the global community along the way. There is absolutely no justification for this reckless act other than to undermine the accomplishments of President Obama and appease the anti-Muslim fervor of President Trump’s political base. It is my hope that Congress will quickly work to reaffirm our commitment to this agreement and our allies, and mitigate the damage of these willfully ignorant actions.
‪Mr. President, if you’re sick of huge insurance company profits and want health care for everybody, I have a plan for you: Medicare for all.‬

Today, Rep. Louise Slaughter and I welcomed health and environmental experts to the U.S. Capitol for a briefing on the dire health risks associated with mountaintop removal mining in Appalachia and our ACHE Act legislation, H.R. 786, that would halt new mining permits until a comprehensive federal health study is conducted. The American people are OWED access to clean air and safe drinking water. Congress must act immediately.

Today we honor our nation’s veterans, thank them for their dedication and sacrifice, and pledge to uphold every commitment made to them for their service. Not just today, but every day we must work to advance veterans’ priorities — including health care and access to services at our VA hospitals, new career opportunities, support for military families, and investing in programs to properly address the mental health crisis that results in 20 veterans taking their own lives each day. These heroes have given so much for our nation, and we need to do far more for them. It is our sacred responsibility.

Early this morning, Senate Republicans abdicated any claim they had to being the party of fiscal responsibility. There is nothing remotely responsible about forcing through a closed-door, hastily conceived bill to give tax cuts to the already wealthy and multi-national corporations. There is nothing American or responsible about increasing our deficit by a trillion dollars, jeopardizing the future of Medicare and Medicaid, or forcing working families to pay more for healthcare, homeownership, and higher education. With all but one GOP Senator supporting Trump’s tax scam, the myth of Republican fiscal responsibility died today. The American people are onto this scam, and Congressional Republicans on both sides of the Capitol would be smart to listen to them.

Responding to allegations of sexual misconduct by trying to publicly shame yet another woman, the president has shown us exactly what kind of person he is.  This is not about politics. Donald Trump has proven to be a poison for the presidency, a cancer on the country, and a truly disgraceful human being.
Happy Hanukkah! Wishing you and your family peace and happiness during this festival of lights.

Today, we remember the 26 young children and educators killed at Sandy Hook Elementary five years ago, and the 170,000 Americans who have died since as a result of gun violence.  “Thoughts and prayers” will never be enough. We owe them ACTION.

Today, the FCC’s Republican majority voted to kill critical net neutrality protections put in place during the Obama Administration. This is a dark day for supporters of a free and open internet. I have heard from thousands of Louisvillians who rightly and vehemently oppose this decision. Under these revised rules, a handful of big corporations will now have near complete control over the internet, with the ability to pick winners and losers among small businesses and decide what content consumers can view or create online. The American people—both Democrats and Republicans—overwhelmingly oppose the FCC’s decision and support a fair and level playing field on the internet. Congress needs to act.

Congressional Republicans just gave final approval to a tax scam that overwhelmingly benefits the wealthy at the expense of middle class families. The resulting massive debt hike by these self-proclaimed deficit hawks is no accident. In their irresponsible assault on America’s budget, Republicans have created their long-sought excuse to gut Medicare, Medicaid, food stamps, education assistance, and other vital programs that millions of Americans depend on.   This is a flagrant betrayal of American families and our national interests.

Congressman John Yarmuth (KY-3) will host a College Prep and Financial Aid Workshop on Tuesday, August 29 from 6:30pm to 8:30pm in Louisville Male Traditional High School’s Gheens Auditorium. A representative from Kentucky Higher Education Assistance Authority (KHEAA) will be on hand to provide students and families with detailed information about college access and the financial aid process.  High school and college students and families from throughout Louisville are invited to participate. KHEAA’s College Info Road Show will also be on-site. Attendees can RSVP at yarmuth.house.gov/rsvp.
